1551311.content:
“I swear on my honor as a mage the gnome who traded it to me said it “possess a great power within…” The black clad figure before Tila Sunrise announced. Inside of Tila’s noisy tavern/guild hall the haggling sessions between the two had been legendarily long and usually with neither of them getting the exact deal they hoped for, even so the two were quite friendly with each other. Now between them was what appeared to be an ordinary truffle, but the conjurer had insisted that there was more to it than what met the eye.

“You know I don’t take anyone at their word, especially yours” the powerful purple leopardess added with a harrumph. “I’m gonna need to see some proof of these “powers” before I buy this “golden” truffle of yours hun” she clawed at the air to form to form quotes, her large looming form and sharp claws also serving as a reminder why nobody tricked Tila.

“Of cour-” his voice rose and cracked as this sight, no matter how many times he saw it, always jolted him, “*Ahem* “Of course! When used correctly in a Gnome’s magic spell, it’s said to grant near impenetrable skin!” he raised his voice hoping to attract attention from Tila, or any other buyers. He took a blade from his waist, it glowed with a red tinted magical power. “Haaa!” he shouted as brought his blade upon the truffle. To no one but his own surprise the truffle split in two.

“Wha, what?” he gasped in puzzlement at the sight.

Tila remained unimpressed by this show. “Well, I think that settles things…” she said rising up to full height and an evil smile on her face. “I’ll give you two gold. One for the truffle and your little show, and one for you to leave my guild hall for a week after that little swindling you tried to pull.”

The mage had no way out, surprised as he was the truffle hadn’t broke he couldn’t possibly explain it. He shrugged before saying “Deal madame. I guess me and the gnome who traded this to me have some unfinished business”

“Well do take care than sugar” said Tila politely handing him the two pieces of gold. Then her face turned into a serious stare and her voiced jumped to a much more threatening tone as she added “Remember though one week. If I see hide or hare of you in my guild hall…” she trailed off not needing to finish, the dark magician understood what would await him or anyone who disobeyed Tila.

He bowed slightly, keeping his head low as he exited through the halls massive wooden doors. He puzzled over what had gone wrong as he exited the large leopard’s domain, had that gnome cheated him? No, he’d assuredly had felt something within the magical object, even if it was in the form of a truffle. It wasn’t long till he realized his unfortunate mistake. Of course the truffle had split when he cut it; in his rush to seal the deal he’d used his own enchanted knife! OH, if he’d only used any other regular weapon on hand, he could have shown how impenetrable it was! Such was the fragile complications that were the laws of magik... Maybe he could go explain to Tila, but wait! She’d told him to stay away. Not one to her anger (or test his luck) he decided against revisiting her. Tila was the most knowledgeable trader he knew in fact... BLAST IT! She probably realized the mistake he’d made, and what a steal she’d gotten for too! That was probably the case, oh well they’d both laugh over it in a week, and with his mind at ease he headed off on his next quest to return in a week.

Meanwhile…

It had been a long night for Tila and she was ready to relax. Getting ready for a nice long bath, she began to undress when she found the two pieces of the truffle rattling around in her pocket. Thinking nothing special of them she placed both halves of the truffle in her mouth, chewing the exotic tasting treat with delight.

"Ahhhh..." she sighed as she relaxed into the extremely large bathtubs hot water she had to admit, even if he’d try to scam her the mage had “sold” her a delicious tasting truffle. Soon Tila was asleep, and unbeknown to her the truffle she had swallowed did indeed possesses great power. As it churned inside her stomach it slowly worked its magic, in this case causing anyone who swallowed it to grow!

The next morning…

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Joy who sought to be a Knight of the Crests. In order to become a Knight, Joy must embark on a quest to prove that she is capable. Though along the way, Joy had unwittingly taken a different path after taking the advice from the writings of carved stone that she mistook of being part of the quest. It was a mistake with consequences that would shake the very foundation of Neo-Earth.

"This is a load of crap!" Joy fumed as she walks through the dense, vine filled forest with no end in sight. "Take the path to eastern lake the rock said. Take the path to the canyon the rock said. All I found was a pond and a goddamn ditch!" Joy proceed to trudge through the path that was directed to her in the seemingly vain hope of finding the end. "If I ever find the guy who wrote that sign on the rock, I'm going to kick him square in th- GYAAGH!!!"

Beneath the antelope's legs, the floor collapsed downwards like a trapdoor that immediately closed the moment the victim fell through. Joy should have saw this one coming she thought as she plummets into the chasm below. However, Joy isn't really all that interested in dying helplessly in a hole and thus used her staff to jab into the walls to at least slow her fall. Joy's efforts have saved her life and managed to hop safely down the bottom floor. The question is though, how exactly is Joy going to get out? She looked around the dimly lit room to see that she can climb on some ledges to get back up but ledges can only go so far up, leaving a giant gap between being trapped and freedom. There is an alternative though, and that is in the form of a cave but it could lead to a dead end.

Joy decided to go through the cave and begins to notice the walls are made with blocks of stone indicating that people have built this place. "That's one hell of a way to make an entry way to this place, at least it shows that I'm on the right path... hopefully."

As Joy walked through the hallway, the place becomes more visible and strangely cleaner for the matter. The architecture begins to show indications that the hall is built in a Nordic style like as if it was built by ancient Vikings. Regardless of the strangely well maintained masonry, Joy's attention was taken by something that she never expected.

An iron chandelier hangs above a large stone table and on is what appears to be a full set of armor. First is the helmet, a jet black sallet adorned with an illustration depicting a long, western dragon. Second is the black, plated pauldrons with gold lining the edges. Third is the dark green, full body scale mail that reach down to the knees. Fourth is the black metal plated war kilt bearing similar dragons that's on the helmet. Fifth is the black, plated boots that reach up to knees. Finally is a bronze medallion of a flaming sun. To Joy, the armor is the most awesome thing she ever saw in her entire life! To make everything even better, written along the side of the stone table says "Bear the armor of the Dragon Queen to prove your worth!"

Joy didn't hesitate to take this opportunity and dons the armor but she quickly begins to notice something. "Everything else seems to fit perfectly fine but why is it so loose at the top?"

155311111.content:
On an uneventful Tuesday in Gossamer, an Arctic fox girl named Pepper-Ann sat at her desk at the library she works all by herself. Through out the day, not one soul walked in the place, not even the high school kids who would use the library's computers would ever came. The books are neatly in placed in the proper shelves, the windows glistened from a recent cleaning, and chairs are placed accordingly along the tables. "This should be the easiest job in the world but I'm bored out of my mind!" Pepper-Ann thought to herself as she lays her head against the desk. "This is the most boring day of my life..."

BOOM! An explosion rocked the library as if it got hit by a artillery shell. Shelves are knocked off their bolted foundations, the windows turned into shattered shrapnel, and almost everything else but the wall of the library have been blown to pieces.

"Oh shit, are we being invaded?!" gasped the frightened fox who is now climbing out of desk she used as protection. "What's going on?" Pepper-Ann said aloud as she looks around the now severely damaged library. She quickly scans the area and immediately towards to what seems to be the epicenter of the explosion, a deep crater where the reading tables were suppose to be. Pepper slowly walked towards the crater, she has no idea what's in there, the possibilities are endless, and some of them are putting her on edge. It could be a wreaking ball that got loose, it could be a meteor, or it could be a live bomb that hasn't detonated yet! The librarian got on her stomach and crawled towards the edges of the newly made pit and saw the most baffling discovery she ever saw in her life.

At the center of the crater, a massive entity kneels on the deepened floor and it remained there as though it were a statue. It's head bears a black helmet with two long horns sprouting out with smaller horns lining up on each main horn. On the side of the helmet are long black ears and flowing brown hair coming from the back of the helm. Pepper-Ann scans the armor the entity is wearing, the thick pauldrons, the plated boots, the scale mail, the... giant breasts? The fox begins to fume and already coming to a conclusion.

"You crazy, top heavy, lumbering bitch!" Pepper-Ann yelled. "You think you can use this library as a cushion for your giant boobs? I have to find a new job no thanks to you!" The librarian continues to banter and hasn't noticed the entity had already moved. "I don't care who you think you are! Hell, I don't even care if you're the fucking High Prime!" Pepper-Ann turns around to head towards the nearest available exit. "I'm going to get the police have them haul your sorry a... *gasp*!" The entity is right in front of her with it's head at Pepper-Ann's eye level. Pepper sees the small artistic details on the helmet but then became too distracted by the two glowing, maroon eyes peering through the helmet's eye slit. The front of the helmet somehow horizontally slides opens to reveal a face of a stern antelope woman who owns the glowing eyes.

"ADDRESS YOURSELF!" bellowed the entity which of course frightens the fox.

"Gah- Wha...?"

"I said, address yourself! If you are willing to rant your opinion about me, at least give me the courtesy to tell me who you are so I would know who I would be killing if you persist in your banter!"

Recomposing herself, Pepper-Ann obliged, "Pepper-Ann, and if we're going to do this courtesy thing you may as well tell me your name so at least I would know who I'm going to do a beat down on!"

The entity brought her right arm to the her left and pulled out a bar of some kind from the left arm's armored brace. She quickly swings the bar to her far right which seems to magically turn the bar into a giant halberd with arcs of electricity sparking from the blade. The entity reveals a grin, "Joy, future Supreme Overlord of Neo-Earth!"

Pepper stands there in shock after seeing what Joy can do. After a few whimpers Pepper spoke,"That is... FUCKING AWESOME!!!" Pepper-Ann said with a big, bright squee face.

"I know, right?" Joy, also bearing a squee face despite having a confrontational talk with the librarian. "I can teleport too!"

"Really? Wait, is that why there's a giant ass crater here?" Pepper-Ann points out the seemingly obvious.

"Oh... right... I really need to work on the landing more, I thought I had it down. Sorry," Joy apologized.

"I bet it's those boobs of yours that helped you make that."

"Actually no, I was trying to aim for the basement of this place and I've... undershot it."

"Well, if you would have walked in here like everyone else does, I could have, you know, help you find what you are looking for." the fox said in a snarky tone.

"Oh yeah, I'm sure you regularly serve twelve foot tall, super villains with the agenda of trying to take over the world..."

"OF COURSE!" yelled Pepper-Ann.

"Huh?" Joy responded with confusion of why the fox said that in a loud and deep tone.

"You don't go on the internet much do you?"

"Enough, I'll consider of sparing your life if you help seek the book called the Codex of the Banished Ancients. It suppose to have history about someone called the Dragon Queen."

"Okay, what makes you think that I'll help you?"

Joy smiled and took a deep breath. She then blew a maroon cloud at Pepper-Ann and the cloud worked it's way into the fox's mouth. Pepper-Ann felt a strong growing sensation in her chest and her blouse began to tighten. It didn't take long for Pepper to find out what it is happening, her breasts are growing rapidly to the size of basketballs!

"Serve me and I'll reward you more!" Joy said as Pepper-Ann begin to squeeze her new breasts to see if they're authentic.

A pudgy panda sat in her jammies at the computer, a bluish tint bathing her room and lighting up her weary face. She shoveled in another handful of puffs and kept tapping away as she licked her fingers. Quite a pile of crumbs had nestled themselves in the crook of Cocoa's shirt where her belly stuck out. Between the stress and Cocoa's tendency toward comfort food, tax season wasn't complete with ten more pounds nestled permanently on her body - mostly her hips. But Cocoa's mind wasn't on that. Also, her address was now listed as ggbhashfffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff ffffffffffffffffffffff. Cocoa decided she had enough time to go shower. As if back in high school, Cocoa immediately glanced away and braced herself. Of course, the woman did nothing to Cocoa. She glanced back up carefully, quickly. The bunny had some loose leaf paper and was sketching something. She glanced at Cocoa again and made no attempt to hide it. Cocoa stopped her jaw from dropping. What was going on? Was the woman...drawing her? Could she do that? Should Cocoa move? She blushed and tried to ignore it. She gulped down her coffee, ignoring the nearly scalding heat. The rabbit kept sketching. Cocoa glanced up. What was with her fur? Was is painted? Was it make up? Such smooth patterns, lines and swirls that hugged her body, drew the eyes. Not in indecent ways, mind you - she had curves that smoothed the bend of her elbow, and rings and swirls about her neck and cheeks that made her look exotic. It was like looking at some strange new work of modern art. Cocoa looked away.

She nibbled at her muffin, but suddenly the rabbit girl left. Cocoa glanced up, looked around, and looked to her table. Some papers had been left! Cocoa looked around again to see if anyone was watching, and then got up and tried to inconspicuously wander over to the other table (it was in fact quite obvious she was being 'sneaky' but Cocoa was too focused to know this). Another sheet had another black-and-white symbol, clearly east asian in inspiration, smooth and round.

"These are...beautiful...." Cocoa mumbled. She often worked with designing logos as part of her graphics business. This was professional-level sketchwork. And.....she had inspired this? Cocoa looked around, and then grabbed the papers. She was pretty embarrassed, and didn't know what was going on. She could do this, right? It's not like the woman had asked her permission. Then again, this wasn't exactly a sketch of herself or anything...she decided to stuff them in her bag and deal with them later. She left the coffee shop in a rush. She still had groceries to get, she decided. She kept her head down, lest she find anyone else staring at her. Could this day get any worse!

Cocoa ended buying the essentials only at the supermarket. The essentials being milk, bread, jam, a couple of other bits, and about six bags of chip and a few two litres. She could go shopping properly later. She could feel those sketches in her bag. She felt like a thief. She should have just let it happen, like she always did. But...something felt so strange, so personal about those designs. She nearly ended up wandering into the wrong cash register line, and then almost tried to pay with her driver's license. This was why she stayed inside!

Rushing home (not that Cocoa could move with any great speed for any great distance) Cocoa ended up dumping the groceries on the kitchen table and going for the sketches. She sat down at the couch (a bag of chips just ended up in her hands, she swore they appeared out of thin air) and went over them more carefully. There was a kind of...spiky softness to them. She couldn't explain it. Round, round, everything was circles or bulbous shapes, but something would suddenly end in a curving point, or something else would be outlined like it had had its fur rubbed the wrong way. There was something....intensely personal about these designs. So abstract, so strange, yet the panda bear felt like they legitimately belonged to her....or had come from her.
1553322222111212.title: Her essence captured

15533222221112122.content:
It had been a week since that strange encounter. Cocoa's taxes were done. But now she really needed to drum up business. Graphic design - logos, digital art, even the occasional concept model for some small-time video game - 3D and 2D were both fine by her. Problem was, while Cocoa's technical skill with her tablet was top-notch, and she was fairly good at the basics of aesthetics, her work never popped out at people. That was why corporations were her main patrons - they didn't want anything that stood out that much, after all. Just like herself, Cocoa couldn't help but think, trying to come up with something. Different enough to stand out, but not really special. Then her eye caught something.

Smudged with chip and cheese dust, a couple papers lay on the edge of her desk. She had almost forgotten them....those woman's designs. They had sat there since that first day - she had meant to do something with them, but what?

"I couldn't....but...." life seemed to have handed Cocoa the perfect opportunity. And Cocoa never argued with life. She was really hitting an artist's block otherwise, so....she picked up one paper, blue off the dust and set it in front of her. She booted up photoshop.

Four hours passed with Cocoa almost unmoving. Her arm kept going, and her eyes glanced back and forth occasionally, but she seemed lost to time. Slowly, ever so carefully, she transformed the picture with all the accuracy of a photocopier. But then she moved to different programs, and began to transform it. Not change it, but turn it from a paper drawing to something 3D . She could see what was supposed to happen. This was supposed to be in front. These were in shadow. The wisps here curled away - those over there were in-line with one another. A strange, almost furry, almost silken zen-like symbol emerged onto her computer. It was spherical, and didn't seem to turn quite at the rate it should have, the shading moving so smoothly that instead of the black-and-white of the typical yin-yang there was one smooth gradient that seemed to wrap around on itself all around the piece. Cocoa finished the last touches, and took what seemed like the first breath in hours. This was.....stunning.....but she didn't feel like she could submit it. It felt so...personal. But Cocoa shook herself out of this. She didn't really have a choice, if she wanted to stay employed. Taking a deep sigh, she prepared to send it to her website as "new for this season"

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It was a week later, and Cocoa was taking a quick break in front of the TV with another bag of chips. She felt horrible. The design....was brilliant. She had gotten positive feedback already - and her site did not attract that many views. People were calling it a "fantasy" design. Like it belonged in D&D . This was dangerously enticing.....Cocoa wondered what Dischorida would do. Getting famous....off of what wasn't even really her own.

"I'll get famous myself!" Cocoa blurted. "That's what she'd say. What kind of low-down thief steals credit!" she was interrupted from her emerging schizophrenia by the doorbell.

"Wha...?" who visited her? She hadn't ordered anything, and it wasn't time for her D&D session yet. Cautiously, she opened the door.

"Why, hello there." the figure in the doorway made Cocoa freeze. The tall black bunny from before! Despite her fear, Cocoa couldn't help but look on with interest. The woman's fur looked almost painted, or dyed, but not quite either. And no dye could be so fine. It was impossible to just look at one part of her. The tribal-like lines across her body, the smooth swirls and curls - as soon as you tried to follow one, it led you everywhere, even hidden under her clothes there seemed to be an unbroken chain.

"I believe you're my muse." the woman said, holding up a piece of paper. It held a printout of Cocoa's design on it. Cocoa swallowed hard. What would Dischordia....?

"P-pardon me. But I think you're mine." she admitted. The woman smiled.

"I think we should talk....."
15533222221112122.title: Inspiration begets Inspiration

choices: “I meant draw ON you, now lose the clothes”
“Oh,did you want to get something to eat first?”
155332222211121222.content:
“Could I come in?” came the rich velvet like voice of the bunny before the bear. The question lingered in the air before Cocoa, who was still too dazed and shocked to act. Angel seeing she wasn’t getting any answers let herself in. As she effortless entered Cocoa’s den her presence seemed to fill the room. Cocoa unconsciously shut the door, but continued to stare at this stalker of sorts. She wasn’t sure but she thought that the tattoos on the stranger’s black body here were somehow different, but just as artistic as the one’s she’d seen before. Her eyes snapped back to attention as she refocused on the main problem: What exactly was she doing here?

“So those pictures you drew uh…” Cocoa began, tiptoeing towards her own guilt as she returned to her seat.

“It’s Angel, and yes what of them?” she said grinning; Angel was going to let this Coca person admit her own guilt, something within her just loved seeing other people uncomfortable.

“Well they were really good.” Were the words Cocoa ended up going with.

“Thank yourself…Coca was it?” Angel said reading off the printout of Cocoa’s designs and website details all while making herself at home on Cocoa’s couch. “Us artist often inspire one another”

“What…you think I’m… c’mon.” Coca said blushing from the compliments.

“Oh yes but your other designs aren’t what I’m here to talk about. You seek my art is inspired by, well other pleasures sinful ones …”Angel hinted.

“What?” Cocoa asked hoping this wasn’t an “invitation.”

“Oh why play coy? You my dear, love to eat, I can tell.” Cocoa caught her drift and her eyes drifted down ashamedly at the floor. If she had a bit more self-esteem she might have asked why Angel had come here just to insult her, but instead only remained silent.

“Oh” Angel gasped seeing the timid panda bear turn upset. “That was supposed to be a compliment. Let me put it another way you are a guiltless gourmand. You see, that’s what’s wrong with society. They’ve made everything taboo! Free enjoyment of sex, drugs, even food. Well it’s there loss, my big bear, I think you’re beautiful and if you just really like food too, than more power to you!”

“You…you really think so?” Coca sniffed.

“Oh yes! I need to draw with you again my muse.” Angel said leaning in closer eyes shining with artistic intent. “And considering the fact of those drawings I did before, and how you didn’t exactly use them with permission.”

Cocoa wouldn’t be drawn again not by this stranger she barely knew, not here… But then again she had used those drawings, and in a way Angel’s determination reminded her of Dischordia…

“Okay, fine!” She agreed balling her pudgy paws into fists.

“Fucking Fantastic!” Angel shouted immediately getting up “I’ll be right back with my brushes and some other things…”and with that she was already out of Cocoa’s doorway. Still a little self-conscious, Coco helped herself to the remains of the potato chip bag at hand but still did not feel any better or less hungry for that matter.

Cocoa saw the tall and black bunny had quickly returned with said in brushes in hand.

And as Angel returned she took note of the pudgy panda before saying...
155332222211121222.title: "Could I come in?"

1553322222112.title: Motivation

choices: *Alternate version of this scenario for Cocoa.*
15533222221121.content:
It was early morning, the sun was just starting to dispel the thin mist that had formed, and the early birds were getting the proverbial worms. This included Cocoa Pau-da, a panda hard at work at her computer in her home. The woman split her time between sketching on the tablet in her lap, and devouring any information she could find about a new update to one of her favorite online games. It was during a particularly vigorous sketching session that her eyes shifted slightly and fell once again on the white curvy expanse of her breasts, an expanse that had gotten somewhat bigger recently. Cocoa also noted yet again how her whole body had been steadily expanding during that same period. She still felt a bit uncertain about it, but much less so than at the beginning.

It all started a number of months ago—though it seemed longer than that to Cocoa; she had just gone through a bad breakup, and had thrown herself completely into her games. She was also eating far more takeout that she probably should have been, but she didn’t feel like going out very much, and just wanted to get away from the real world for a time. After a while of this, some of her friends finally convinced her to move on and get back out in the world. She had done it grudgingly at first, but kept at it, knowing that they were only trying to help. Over time, all of them started to become less concerned about the panda as she came out of her self-imposed shell again. One of them however kept up spending more time with Cocoa.

It started out as just little friendly invitations out for coffee or a movie or something, but over time Cocoa noticed it was starting to be less friendly and more romantic. She also noticed that the invitations were more often than not involving food, and increasing amounts of it: little boxes of chocolates became big boxes of chocolates, asking if she wanted desert became ordering desert and asking her to eat it, a small soda and popcorn at the movies became a large soda and popcorn along with a big box of candy or two, and so on and so forth. It had been subtle and slow, so Cocoa didn’t notice it happening, or didn’t want to admit that she noticed it happening, perhaps too caught up in a giddy mix of emotions she thought she wouldn’t experience again. She was also surprised to find that she was liking the attention as well as the food; what the food was doing to her on the hand, she was still unsure about, her free hand probing the soft fur and fat of her larger stomach.

Things had taken on a more serious tone as well; last night was just the latest in a small number of times they spent together, making passionate love together till they both passed out from exhaustion. Cocoa blushed as she remembered some of the things she had experienced the night before, as well as similar events throughout the preceding weeks. Something had also occurred to her last night; she realized that the sex had been getting even more passionate and lust filled as her weight slowly crept up. She had come across mentions of FAs, FFAs, feeders, feedees, and so on during her time spent online, but had never put much thought into it; and yet, now it seemed almost certain that she in a relationship with someone who seemed to enjoy her pudge and most likely wanted even more of it on her body. The thought was shocking to Cocoa, but also a bit thrilling on some level.

She was stirred out of her whirling thoughts by the sound of a creaking floorboard from behind her, as well as a familiar scent tickling her nose. Before she could react, a pair of arms fell onto her shoulders and encircled her neck. Those arms belonged to someone distinctly…
